custom_fields.key_topics: Parallel Programming, Generating and Analyzing Algorithms, Higher Order Programming, Practical Applications - Data Analysis, Graphics, Text Processing.
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge: None, but familiarity with SML is highly recommended
custom_fields.assessment_structure: Assignments 40 percent, Exam 1 - 15 percent, Exam 2 - 15 percent, Final 26 percent, Recitation Participation 4 percent.
custom_fields.goals: Learn how to design, analyze, and program algorithms and data structures with a functional programming language. Ability to analyze algorithms with an emphasis on parallelism.
custom_fields.relevance: For students already experienced with fundamentals of functional programming
custom_fields.learning_resources: Course Textbook, AutoLab, Gradescope, Piazza, Notation Supplement, Course Website

long_desc: Teaches students about how to design, analyze, and program algorithms and data structures.  The course emphasizes parallel algorithms and analysis, and how sequential algorithms can be considered a special case.  The course goes into more theoretical content on algorithm analysis than 15122 and 15150 while still including a significant programming component and covering a variety of practical applications such as problems in data analysis, graphics, text processing, and the computational sciences.  NOTE students must achieve a C or better in order to use this course to satisfy the prerequisite for any subsequent Computer  Science course. Register for Lecture 1.  All students will be waitlisted for Lecture 2 until Lecture 1 is full.

prereqs.text: (15-150 at least C) and (15-122 at least C)

name: Parallel and Sequential Data Structures and Algorithms
base_name: Parallel and Sequential Data Structures and Algorithms
